subject: Olympic Games (2010)
Bonuses
lead_paragraph: Russian sports authorities said they would more than double bonus payments for medal winners at the 2010 Winter Olympics in Vancouver in a bid for a record-beating performance. Gennady Alyoshin, the deputy sports minister, said gold-medal winners would receive $135,000, silver winners would earn roughly $81,600 and bronze medalists $54,400. Russia, which will host the 2014 games in Sochi, is aiming for 40 medals at next year’s Games, with a minimum of nine golds. That would be almost double its 22-medal haul in Turin, Italy, in 2006.
